dishes.name: Dal Baati Churma
dishes.description: A traditional Rajasthani delicacy consisting of baked dough balls (baati) served with lentil curry (dal) and a sweet crumbled wheat dessert (churma).

dishes.name: Gatte ki Sabzi
dishes.description: A flavorful curry made with gram flour (besan) dumplings (gatte) cooked in a spicy yogurt-based gravy, often served with rice or roti.

dishes.name: Laal Maas
dishes.description: A fiery red meat curry made with tender mutton cooked in a rich and spicy gravy, flavored with traditional Rajasthani spices.

dishes.name: Ker Sangri
dishes.description: A unique Rajasthani dish made with dried desert beans (sangri) and wild berries (ker), cooked with spices to create a tangy and flavorful side dish.

dishes.name: Mirchi Vada
dishes.description: Spicy green chilies stuffed with a tangy potato filling, coated in gram flour batter, and deep-fried until crispy and golden brown, a popular street food snack in Rajasthan.

dishes.name: Bajre ki Roti
dishes.description: A traditional flatbread made from pearl millet (bajra) flour, commonly served with ghee (clarified butter), curries, or chutney in Rajasthani households.

dishes.name: Aloo Pyaaz Kachori
dishes.description: Deep-fried pastry pockets filled with a spicy mixture of mashed potatoes (aloo) and onions (pyaaz), typically served as a savory snack or breakfast item.
